result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Ulrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:15pm. 
Defendant Brian J Ulrich in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " Guilty  " entered on Count #1 ; factual basis stipulated including as to Repeater status; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Ulrich guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Ulrich to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to the time that Mr. Ulrich is currently serving.  

The Court finds that Mr. Ulrich is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Ulrich is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision the conditions set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement form [which are:
--no contact with Nathan Schroedl
--no presence at the residence of Nathan Schroedl
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of any non-prescribed controlled substances
--to submit to drug/alcohol testing as directed by the Agent
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges including the $250 DNA surcharge]


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:58pm.
Relief desired is granted

Case called at 1:08pm [mo]
Defendant Brian J Ulrich in court, in custody.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Ulrich indicates that he wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.

After review of Preliminary Hearing rights; The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Mr. Ulrich indicates that he has applied for SPD representation
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
recess: 1:16pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/17/16 at 9:00am    (2) Status Conference on 9/20/16 at 10:30am
Copy of Letter from SPD to Defendant regarding process for appointment of SPD counsel

[MK] clerk telephones a Kettle Moraine staffperson in response to a voicemail left yesterday (7/20/16) regarding Mr. Ulrich appearing by telephone for the Pretrial Conference.   The clerk did not check her voicemails timely, so the clerk did not hear the voicemail before the 2:00 scheduled Pretrial Conference time.   The clerk indicates that she is noting this in the Court Record.  
During today's telephone conversation the clerk verifies with the Kettle Moraine staffperson that the facility is aware of the writ for Mr. Ulrich's transport on 7/26/16 for the Preliminary Hearing.  Further, when the staffperson asks about counsel for Mr. Ulrich, the clerk clarifies that there is no defense attorney listed in the case and that Mr. Ulrich indicated that he would either retain counsel or apply for PD representation.  The staffperson (Joan) indicates that she will pass on a message this morning to Mr. Ulrich's assigned social worker, providing Mr. Ulrich with the contact information for the Jefferson Public Defender's Office.

Case called at 2:35 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Brian J Ulrich appears via video, in-custody, from Kettle Moraine Correctional. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

DOB confirmed accurate; Service of Complaint admitted; maximum penalties recited; reading waived; 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Nathan Schroedl  
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at W3216 Depot Rd. Helenville
-No possession of any dangerous weapons
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Michael Zenoni or Jason Brom 

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Ulrich informs the Court that he would like to retain counsel, but will likely have to seek a Public Defender
ADA Shock requests that the Court set a DA PTC and preliminary hearing 
Mr. Ulrich informs the Court that he will likely be staying at Kettle Moraine
